verses.verse: Remember <S%H2142><s%> also thy Creator <S%H1254><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of thy youth <S%H979><s%>, before the evil <S%H7451><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> come <S%H935><s%>, and the years <S%H8141><s%> draw nigh <S%H5060><s%>, when thou shalt say <S%H559><s%>, I have no pleasure in them <S%H2656><s%>;

before the sun <S%H8121><s%>, and the light <S%H216><s%>, and the moon <S%H3394><s%>, and the stars <S%H3556><s%>, are darkened <S%H2821><s%>, and the clouds <S%H5645><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the rain <S%H1653><s%>;

in the day <S%H3117><s%> when the keepers <S%H8104><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> shall tremble <S%H2111><s%>, and the strong <S%H2428><s%> men <S%H582><s%> shall bow <S%H5791><s%> themselves <S%H2912><s%>, and the grinders cease <S%H988><s%> because they are few <S%H4591><s%>, and those that look out <S%H7200><s%> of the windows <S%H699><s%> shall be darkened <S%H2821><s%>,

and the doors <S%H1817><s%> shall be shut <S%H5462><s%> in the street <S%H7784><s%>; when the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the grinding <S%H2913><s%> is low <S%H8217><s%>, and one shall rise up <S%H6965><s%> at the voice <S%H6963><s%> of a bird <S%H6833><s%>, and all the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of music <S%H7892><s%> shall be brought low <S%H7817><s%>;

yea <S%H3372><s%>, they shall be afraid of that which is high <S%H1364><s%>, and terrors <S%H2849><s%> shall be in the way <S%H1870><s%>; and the almond-tree <S%H8247><s%> shall blossom <S%H5006><s%>, and the grasshopper <S%H2284><s%> shall be a burden <S%H5445><s%>, and desire <S%H35><s%> shall fail <S%H6565><s%>; because man <S%H120><s%> goeth <S%H1980><s%> to his everlasting <S%H5769><s%> home <S%H1004><s%>, and the mourners <S%H5594><s%> go about <S%H5437><s%> the streets <S%H7784><s%>:

before <S%H3808><s%> the silver <S%H3701><s%> cord <S%H2256><s%> is loosed <S%H7576><s%>, or the golden <S%H2091><s%> bowl <S%H1543><s%> is broken <S%H7533><s%>, or the pitcher <S%H3537><s%> is broken <S%H7533><s%> at the fountain <S%H4002><s%>, or the wheel <S%H1534><s%> broken <S%H7665><s%> at the cistern <S%H953><s%>,
and the dust <S%H6083><s%> returneth <S%H7725><s%> to the earth <S%H776><s%> as it was <S%H7307><s%>, and the spirit returneth <S%H7725><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%> who gave it <S%H5414><s%>.
Vanity <S%H1892><s%> of vanities <S%H1892><s%>, saith <S%H559><s%> the Preacher <S%H6953><s%>; all is vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

And further <S%H3148><s%>, because the Preacher <S%H6953><s%> was wise <S%H2450><s%>, he still taught <S%H3925><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>; yea <S%H239><s%>, he pondered, and sought out <S%H2713><s%>, and set in order <S%H8626><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> proverbs <S%H4912><s%>.

The Preacher <S%H6953><s%> sought <S%H1245><s%> to find out <S%H4672><s%> acceptable <S%H2656><s%> words <S%H1697><s%>, and that which was written <S%H3789><s%> uprightly <S%H3476><s%>, even words <S%H1697><s%> of truth <S%H571><s%>.

The words <S%H1697><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> are as goads <S%H1861><s%>; and as nails <S%H4930><s%> well fastened <S%H5193><s%> are the words of the masters <S%H1167><s%> of assemblies <S%H627><s%>, which are given <S%H5414><s%> from one <S%H259><s%> shepherd <S%H7462><s%>.

And furthermore <S%H3148><s%>, my son <S%H1121><s%>, be admonished <S%H2094><s%>: of <S%H1992><s%> making <S%H6213><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> books <S%H5612><s%> there is no end <S%H7093><s%>; and much <S%H7235><s%> study <S%H3854><s%> is a weariness <S%H3024><s%> of the flesh <S%H1320><s%>.

This is the end <S%H5490><s%> of the matter <S%H1697><s%>; all hath been heard <S%H8085><s%>: fear <S%H3372><s%> God <S%H430><s%>, and keep <S%H8104><s%> his commandments <S%H4687><s%>; for this is the whole duty of man <S%H120><s%>.

For God <S%H430><s%> will bring <S%H935><s%> every work <S%H4639><s%> into judgment <S%H4941><s%>, with every hidden thing <S%H5956><s%>, whether it be good <S%H2896><s%>, or whether it be evil <S%H7451><s%>.
